critique: This document delegates authority from the President to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development regarding the purchase of mortgages by the Government National Mortgage Association. This appears to be primarily an administrative action. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to have a slight impact on federalism by centralizing power at the federal level, and a slight impact on economic regulation by influencing the housing market. There is no impact on social inclusion.
